results.title: The Mole and the matchbox
results.brief_description: In this animated story, the Mole comes upon a matchbox. The Mole and the Mouse then devise many amusing activities with the box and the matches, accidentally discovering the true purpose of matches. Without narration.

results.title: Lincoln County incident
results.brief_description: A satiric western set in the South Island of New Zealand with a cast and crew of over 100 - all children from a New Zealand secondary school. It involves the escapades of diminutive Sampson Peabody-Jones who, in 1881, heads west in search of adventure and a new life. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Abseiling
results.brief_description: An instructional film on abseiling techniques. Shows how to set up a classic abseil and a standard abseil and illustrates methods of rope control and descent. Presupposes a knowledge of preparatory techniques. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Dudu and the line
results.creator_credit: Steve French and Second Banana Films
results.brief_description: Explores the magic and fun of animation through Dudu, an ordinary little chap who encounters an extraordinary line which obeys nothing but the animator’s imagination. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Evolution: the four billion year legacy
results.creator_credit: David F. Oyster, David Kennard, Richard Wells, Rob McCain, Gregory Andorfer, Carl Sagan Productions and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description: Dr. Carl Sagan discusses the fossil record, the respective evolutionary theories of Darwin and Wallace and the alternative explanation of a “great designer”. Shows that life forms developed comparatively late in terms of the development of the cosmos as a whole and a computer-animated sequence recapitulates the path of evolution from the single-celled organism to the first human.

results.title: Force & motion: Newton's 3 Laws
results.creator_credit: P. David Langley and Barr Films
results.brief_description: Using experiments and laboratory demonstrations, this basic physics film clearly explains Newton’s three fundamental laws of force and motion: the velocity of an object remains constant unless a force acts upon the object; Force=Mass * Acceleration; and to every action there is an equal and opposite reaction.

results.title: Your own place
results.brief_description: Humorously explains the pitfalls of renting and looking after oneself. Two 18 year-old boys rent a flat and fall into strife over bills, shopping, cooking and sharing of tasks; their ever-present landlady/caretaker is always ready to provide sound advice. Raises for consideration the following points: lease v monthly tenancy, rent and bond, secondhand v new furniture, phone installation costs, laundering of clothing, economical places to shop, budgeting, hygiene in the kitchen, basic cooking procedures and rostering of household tasks. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Seeing through commercials
results.creator_credit: Larry Stein, Ruth Arens and Barr Films
results.brief_description: Designed to alert younger children to the techniques and motivations behind television commercials. Shows how close-up shots, camera angles, lighting and special effects can make products seem bigger and more exciting than they really are, and points out how the narration in commercials can be misleading. Also notes how important product information and disclaimers are often included very briefly and subtly at the end of a commercial. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Feeling good about yourself
results.creator_credit: Alan Shulman and Feeling Good Associates
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the “yes-no” process - a dynamic method of assertiveness training - with a group of intellectually handicapped people. Shows participants in a workshop going through discussion sessions and experiential exercises exploring issues such as victimisation, making oneself understood, self-esteem, personal strength and sex education. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Prisoners of chance
results.creator_credit: Thom Eberhardt, Marc Stirdivant, FilmFair Communications and Vitascope Productions
results.brief_description: Presents dramatized re-enactments of three case studies of teenage pregnancies: a girl who gives up her baby for adoption when she realizes she cannot cope; a girl who lives with her parents after the birth; and a couple who marries after the girl becomes pregnant. De-romanticises the notion of “Having a baby” by pointing out some commo problems of teenage pregnancies.
